item.description:
Hi! I’m Milan Williams. I build security products that developers love.

I’m a Senior Product Manager at Semgrep, a high-growth cybersecurity startup. I lead the teams responsible for Semgrep Code (SAST) and Secrets detection products.

Before Semgrep, I graduated from Harvard University with degrees in Computer Science and Physics, where I spent most of my time in the Adams House library. â¤ï¸ğŸ’›

In my free time, you can find me geeking about the latest in security / developer tooling, running in San Francisco’s Golden Gate Park, or enjoying local theater.

item.title: entrepreneurship requires discipline, not motivation
item.description:
Every year on January 1st, like many others, I get motivated to start a healthier diet.

Iâ€™ll get a gym membership, search up a new recipe or two, drink lots of water and eat kale â€” until thereâ€™s an obstacle. A big project at school, a night out with friends, or simple forgetfulness is all it takes for my diet to slip through the cracks. After that point, I give up, only to start again the next year. Creating a healthier lifestyle, like entrepreneurship, requires discipline. Motivation alone isnâ€™t enough to be sustainable. Just like the latest dieting fad, it can be easy to glamourize entrepreneurship. The allure of â€œBe Your Own Bossâ€ and â€œThe Four-Hour Workweekâ€ combined with an inundation of startup success stories, can easily make the life of an entrepreneur appear idyllic. However, many entrepreneurs more closely identify with the swimming duck â€” calm on the surface, but paddling furiously beneath the water.
